newsitem.title: USA: Veritas to merge with OpenVision.
newsitem.headline: Veritas to merge with OpenVision.

text.p: Veritas Software Corp on Monday said it signed a definitive agreement to merge with OpenVision Technologies Inc.
Veritas said in a statement that the deal was structured as a tax-free, pooling of interests stock deal, which will result in OpenVision will be merged into Veritas.
Veritas will exchange 7.5 million shares of its stock, valued at about $400 million for about 21 million shares and options of OpenVision.
Subject to regulatory and shareholder approval, the deal is expected to close within three months.
Both companies' boards of directors have approved the deal, while holders of about 55 percent of OpenVision voting common stock have agreed to vote in favor of the merger.

Mark Leslie of Veritas will serve as co-chairman, president, and chief executive officer of the combined company. OpenVision's chief executive, Geoffrey Squire, will serve as co-chairman and executive vice president of worldwide sales and service. Squire will report to Leslie.
Veritas is a supplier of operating system components for storage management. OpenVision is a provider of client/server systems management software.
